user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_lookup_header_token_ci:
```c
static bool
MHD_lookup_header_token_ci (const struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                            const char *header,
                            size_t header_len,
                            const char *token,
                            size_t token_len)
{
  struct MHD_HTTP_Req_Header *pos;

  if ((NULL == connection) || (NULL == header) || (0 == header[0]) ||
      (NULL == token) || (0 == token[0]))
    return false;

  for (pos = connection->rq.headers_received; NULL != pos; pos = pos->next)
  {
    if ((0 != (pos->kind & MHD_HEADER_KIND)) &&
        (header_len == pos->header_size) &&
        ( (header == pos->header) ||
          (MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_ (header,
                                          pos->header,
                                          header_len)) ) &&
        (MHD_str_has_token_caseless_ (pos->value, token, token_len)))
      return true;
  }
  return false;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No invariant controlling expressions were found in the function. Specifically:
- The initial if condition (if ((NULL == connection) || (NULL == header) || (0 == header[0]) || (NULL == token) || (0 == token[0])) ...) depends on the function parameters and is not constant.
- The for loop (for (pos = connection->rq.headers_received; NULL != pos; pos = pos->next)) uses NULL != pos as the loop condition but pos is updated each iteration (pos = pos->next), so the controlling expression is not invariant.
- The inner if condition ((0 != (pos->kind & MHD_HEADER_KIND)) && (header_len == pos->header_size) && ((header == pos->header) || (MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_(...))) && (MHD_str_has_token_caseless_(...))) depends on pos and the input parameters and is therefore not invariant.
- There are no while(1), for(;;), do-while with constant true/false, or other constant controlling expressions present.
Given the above, no code fragments violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 in this function and there are no suspicious invariant controlling expressions to investigate.
